edu.bu.hw3.nn.models

Class Sequential

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.bu.hw3.nn.Module
      • edu.bu.hw3.nn.Model
        • edu.bu.hw3.nn.models.Sequential

  • public class Sequential
extends Model
    A Model that represents a neural network where layers are arranged sequentially (i.e. a line graph). Here is example code to create a feed-forward network with 1 hidden layer (3 layers total), where the hidden layer has 50 units inside it, the input layer has 20 units, and the output layer has 2 units. The hidden layer uses a ReLU activation function while the output layer uses a Sigmoid activation function with a coefficient of 3: Sequential m = new Sequential(); // add the hidden layer m.add(new Dense(20, 50)) m.add(new ReLU()) // add the output layer m.add(new Dense(50, 2)) m.add(new Sigmoid(3.0))

      • add

      • forward

        public Matrix forward(Matrix X)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        A method to pass data through the Model. This Model passes data one layer at a time, walking from the front of the Model to the end. The final output of this Model is the output from the last layer in this Model.
        Specified by:
        forward in class Module
        Parameters:
        X - a batch of input vectors
        Returns:
        The output vectors of the final layer, having been processed by all layers in this Model sequentially
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • backwards

        public Matrix backwards(Matrix X,
                        Matrix dLoss_dModule)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        A method to calculate dLoss_dX where X is the input to this Model. This Model is responsible for calculating all intermediary derivatives through it's layers, where each layer (i.e. a Module) is responsible for calculating all internal derivatives (such as derivatives contained with each Module). This method starts by doing a forward pass with X to cache all intermediary values, and then walks from the last layer to the first, calculating derivatives as it goes. This is an implementation of the backpropagation algorithm in practice.
        Specified by:
        backwards in class Module
        Parameters:
        X - the input to this Model
        dLoss_dModule - the total derivative up to this Model (typically the output of some lossFunction.backwards())
        Returns:
        dLoss_dX
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String filePath)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        An method to load the contents of a Model saved at the path specified by the argument, and overwrites the current content of this Model's Parameters with the contents of the file. This does not change the topology of this Model nor its dimensionality, the saved Parameters and this Model's Parameters must align or an Exception will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        load in class Model
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to the file whose contents will overwrite this Model's Parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
